extractions.title: Integrated genetic analysis of Alzheimer's disease and stroke subtypes: insights from LDSC, PLACO, and MR studies.

extractions.trait: Alzheimer's disease (AD)
extractions.method_detail: Text cites an estimate of variance explained by common variants (SNP-heritability context) but does not report LDSC output details (h2 SE/intercept/lambda) here; value appears to be referenced from prior literature (citations [41,42]) rather than newly estimated in this paper.
extractions.ancestry: European (implied by LDSC reference panel: 1000 Genomes European ancestry used as reference)

extractions.method_detail: Text cites an estimate of variance explained by common variants (SNP-heritability context) but does not report LDSC output details (h2 SE/intercept/lambda) here; value appears to be referenced from prior literature (citations [41,42]) rather than newly estimated in this paper.

extractions.title: Alzheimer disease is (sometimes) highly heritable: Drivers of variation in heritability estimates for binary traits, a systematic review.

extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD)
extractions.method_detail: GCTA-GREML; estimate reported for Lee et al. (2013) in review text; based on 7,139 participants (3,290 cases, 3,849 controls).
extractions.source_text: “The resulting LOAD heritability estimate of 24% was based on a sample of 7,139 participants (3,290 cases, 3,849 controls)…”
extractions.evidence_html: ...Table 2 ). The first LOAD GCTA heritability estimates were published in 2013 ( Table 2 and Fig 3 ). The resulting LOAD heritability estimate of 24% was based on a sample of 7,139 participants (3,290 cases, 3,849 controls) that included both elderly screened and population controls [ 71 , 72 ]. extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD)
extractions.method_detail: GCTA-GREML; Ridge et al. (2016) ADGC update; required non-missing data across 21 known AD genes; N=9,699 (3,877 cases, 5,822 controls).

extractions.evidence_html: ...ore comprehensive analyses of LOAD. A 2016 update included data from 30 studies within the ADGC, and the heritability estimate increased to 53%. extractions.trait: Late-onset Alzheimer’s disease (LOAD) (very large SNP-based study; method not stated in excerpt)

extractions.title: Uncovering pleiotropic loci in allergic rhinitis and leukocyte traits through multi-trait GWAS.

extractions.trait: Allergic rhinitis (AR)
extractions.method_detail: Single-trait SNP heritability estimated from GWAS summary statistics using LD Score regression (HapMap3 SNPs; EUR LD scores from 1000 Genomes; INFO<0.9 excluded).
extractions.source_text: We utilized LDSC to estimate SNP-based heritability... Based on the summary statistics from GWAS on allergic rhinitis, the estimated heritability on the observed scale was 2.08% in the European popula

extractions.trait: Allergic rhinitis (AR)
extractions.method_detail: Single-trait SNP heritability estimated from GWAS summary statistics using LD Score regression (HapMap3 SNPs; EAS LD scores from 1000 Genomes; INFO<0.9 excluded).
extractions.ancestry: East Asian (BioBank Japan AR GWAS: 7,897 cases + 153,666 controls)
extractions.source_text: Based on the summary statistics from GWAS on allergic rhinitis, the estimated heritability on the observed scale was 2.08% in the European population and 1.03% in the East Asian population.
extractions.evidence_html: ...lity, thereby determining the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by the detected variants. Based on the summary statistics from GWAS on allergic rhinitis, the estimated heritability on the observed scale was 2.08% in the European population and 1.03% in the East Asian population.
